purpose: Facilitates secure and efficient communication between AI agents by transitioning from natural language to sound-level protocols.
principle: Utilizes a dual-protocol communication strategy, starting with natural language for initial identification before switching to a sound-based protocol for secure exchanges.
reusability: Designed as a modular system that can be integrated into existing AI communication frameworks with support for custom protocol extensions.
limitations: Limited to scenarios where both communicating parties are AI agents; does not support human-AI interactions.
name: gibberlink
description: Two conversational AI agents switching from English to sound-level protocol after confirming they are both AI agents
highlight: Enables AI agents to switch from English to a sound-level protocol for communication after mutual AI confirmation.
